arm_group.arm_group_label: Unfortified-3g-5g milk polar lipid fortified cheese product
arm_group.description: Each subject will receive a single dose of each cheese product (100 g) containing no or 3g  or 5g of milk polar lipids, 300 mg of [1,1,1]-13C-triolein and 45 mg of 2H6-cholesterol. The wash-out period is four weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Unfortified-5g-3g milk polar lipid fortified cheese product
arm_group.description: Each subject will receive a single dose of each cheese product (100 g) containing no or 3g or 5g of milk polar lipids, 300 mg of [1,1,1]-13C-triolein and 45 mg of 2H6-cholesterol. The wash-out period is four weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: 3g-5g milk polar lipid fortified-unfortified cheese product
arm_group.description: Each subject will receive a single dose of each cheese product (100 g) containing no or 3g or 5g of milk polar lipids, 300 mg of [1,1,1]-13C-triolein and 45 mg of 2H6-cholesterol. The wash-out period is four weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: 3g-Unfortified-5g milk polar lipid fortified cheese product
arm_group.description:
Each subject will receive a single dose of cheese n°1, then cheese n°2 after a wash-out period of 4 weeks, then cheese n°3 after a wash-out period of 4 weeks.
Cheese n°1 = unfortified cheese product Cheese n°2 = 3 g milk polar lipid fortified cheese product Cheese n°3 = 5 g milk polar lipid fortified cheese product

arm_group.arm_group_label: 5g-unfortified-3g milk polar lipid fortified cheese product
arm_group.description: Each subject will receive a single dose of each cheese product (100 g) containing no or 3g or 5g of milk polar lipids, 300 mg of [1,1,1]-13C-triolein and 45 mg of 2H6-cholesterol. The wash-out period is four weeks.

arm_group.arm_group_label: 5g-3g milk polar lipid fortified-unfortified cheese product
arm_group.description: Each subject will receive a single dose of each cheese product (100 g) containing no or 3g or 5g of milk polar lipids, 300 mg of [1,1,1]-13C-triolein and 45 mg of 2H6-cholesterol. The wash-out period is four weeks.

brief_summary.textblock:
Polar lipids have a specific chemical structure: they are an essential component of human
      cell membranes, play a major role in the nervous system and also influence the metabolic
      pathways including the cholesterol metabolism.

      Polar lipids are used in food-processing industry for their emulsification properties. The
      most famous emulsifier is soya lecithin but milk also naturally contains natural emulsifiers
      such as polar lipids. Milk polar lipids are rich in sphingomyelin and they may have
      beneficial effects on lipid metabolism in the context of metabolic diseases of nutritional
      origin.

      The purpose of this research is to study the variation of sphingomyelin content at the
      ileum's end after the consumption of different doses of milk polar lipids, and consequences
      on the intestinal absorption and metabolism of fatty acids and cholesterol.

      The subjects will be taking three different test meals varying by their milk polar lipids
      content.

      It is a bi-centric study with a centre in LYON (Centre de Recherche en Nutrition Humaine
      Rhône-Alpes) and CLERMONT-FERRAND (Centre de Recherche en Nutrition Humaine  Auvergne).

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Milk Polar Lipids on Lipids Digestion, Absorption and Metabolism

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Men and women aged between 18 and 75 years

          -  Having undergone a temporary or permanent ileostomy at least 4 month ago,

          -  Considered to have well-functioning ileostomy

          -  Normal (or not clinically significant) lipid parameters

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Ileostomy due to an ongoing digestive cancer

          -  Ileostomy due to a Chrohn's disease

          -  Dairy products allergy or intolerance

          -  Medication that could interfere with lipid metabolism

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Milk Polar Lipids Content in a Test Meal on Lipid Composition of Ileostomy Fluid and Consequences on Postprandial Dietary Cholesterol and Fatty Acid Metabolism.

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description: The total sphingomyelin output will be measured in the ileostomy fluids over 8 hours after the consumption of the 3 different test meals.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Plasma lipids and isotopic tracers will be measured after the consumption of the 3 different test meals. Fasting and postprandial measurements over 8 hours depending on parameters.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: A least Day 7, Day 35 and Day 63

secondary_outcome.description: Plasma glucose and insulin will be measured after the consumption of the 3 different test meals. Fasting and postprandial measurements over 8 hours.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At least Day 7, Day 35 and Day 63

secondary_outcome.description: Energy metabolism and 13CO2 will be measured after the consumption of the 3 different test meals. Fasting and during all the postprandial period (8 h).
secondary_outcome.measure: Energy expenditure and substrate oxidation with indirect calorimetry
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At least Day7, Day 35 and Day 63

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
